intro: Parasyringa sempervirens, commonly known as the evergreen lily, is a species of flowering plant in the family Liliaceae. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant produces sword-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Parasyringa sempervirens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators.
